intro: Pleurostachys bradei var. alata, commonly known as the winged dragon tree, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Agavaceae family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves that have a distinctive wing-like structure on the margins. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by red berries. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
